Sentence: On the trip south to the capital, called King's Landing, Robert's and Cersei's son, Joffrey, and Ned's daughter Sansa, who everyone presumes will be married one day, go for a walk
As punishment, Cersei wants Arya's wolf killed, but since it ran away after hurting Joffrey, Cersei demands that Ned kill Sansa's wolf instead

In King's Landing, Ned has figured out why the Hand was killed: he (Ned) had discovered that Joffrey was not really Robert's child but was actually the product of Cersei's sexual relationship with her (knight) brother, Jaime
Ned does not tell Robert that he (Ned) knows Joffrey is not the true heir, since he (Ned) is the son of Cersei and Jaime
But when Ned confronts the Lannisters, saying that Joffrey is not the true heir and expecting Littlefinger's support, Littlefinger betrays him (Ned), and Cersei imprisons Ned for treason
